p: Our study assessed the anti- Acanthamoeba activity of Cambodian medicinal plants, including A. muricata and C. trifoliatum extracts against trophozoites and cysts of A. triangularis. To support our findings, amebic metabolic activity of A. castellanii was reduced following its treatment with multipurpose solutions containing A. muricata extract. Moreover, the solution suppressed pseudocyst formation in the organism ( Ramírez et al., 2018). A. muricata aqueous leaf extract inhibited the growth of Plasmodium berghei infected mice with no toxicity ( Somsak et al., 2016). It has also been described that ethyl acetate extract of A. muricata leaves exhibited anti-microbial activity against Leishmania spp. and Trypanosoma cruzi ( Osorio et al., 2007). Besides, anthelmintic effects of the aqueous leaf extract against eggs, infective larvae and adult forms of Haemonchus contortus isolated from sheep have been reported ( Ferreira et al., 2013).
